title: DO NOT BUFF PANTHEON RIOT
body:
Everyone on reddit calling him "no damage and weak", and we have seen what happens every single time after that happens, champs gets buffed while he was already OP but nobody knew how to play him so then he becomes giga broken for months.

Give him some time, please no kneejerk buffs to his whole kit like it happened to yuumi, for the love of god.

His old E could never crit unless ur talking about the Q and auto thing, which he still kinda has on his Q.

Anyway, here's old E and new E damage:

Old
100 / 150 / 200 / 250 / 300 (+ 300% bonus AD)

New
55 / 105 / 155 / 205 / 255 (+ 150% bonus AD) +100%/166% AD

New one unempowered deals more damage at almost every stage of the game (until you have enough AD to make 300% bonus > 150% bonus +100% total, which takes quite a bit). Assuming at least 1 adaptive force rune, it deals 125 (+150% bonus AD) physical damage at level 1 rank 1 unempowered w/ no items.

The empowered version out-damages the old one at all stages of the game.

The new one does require hitting that shield slap for the majority of its damage though (but you can reactivate to end earlier and you can move with it as well).

But yes, it is in fact a DPS loss because it's being done at double the duration (overall a little less than half the old DPS).

Also the new one waveclears better (old had 60% reduced to minions, new has 50% and as stated above deals overall more damage over the duration while also not having any reduced effect on the slam portion).

The crit thing I mentioned was this 
>PASSIVE - CERTAIN DEATH: Pantheon's basic attacks and Spear Shot Spear Shot Critical strike icon critically strike all enemies Health icon below 15% maximum health.

which used to be on his E(you could argue a part of it is on his Q but it doesn't count as a crit, is only on the throw and has different breakpoints) but he completely lost the crit synergy and guaranteed crit autos.

And you're terribly mispresenting the E because while you're showing the correct numerical values, you forgot that this damage gets spread out throughout the duration, and the new E has a longer duration than the old one.(you can basically just take the value and add a +100% bAD with a situational +200%bAd as he will get to smack down an auto attack in the time the new one is still going on even with no as items, and will sometimes even crit because of the old passive)

If you compared the same time frame for doing damage, the New E is worse at every respect if you factor in that after Eing you resume autoing, and if the target is low at that point you also might go into the automatic AA crit territory.

Agreed, once people (including me) realize that you basically have to get an empowered Q off whenever you can afford it after maybe the first strike to get your keystone (Conq or PTA) triggered with your W (which also sets your Q up to be empowered in two autos) and internalize it, the damage gets gross.

EDIT: Especially since according to the Wiki his E does like, little more than an auto attack in damage.
As I recall, its damage is exactly that of an auto without it being empowered.

Darius blows against competent opponents. Your own fault if you get hit by his slow telegraphed Q. He has zero mobility and low range, and zero defensive tools. He has to actually land his skill shot to heal (unlike say, adcs who can't miss when lifestealing, or champs like aatrox with so much sustain against champs AND minions in ALL of his damage sources). In a fight between equal players, champs like jax and aatrox will destroy darius. Meaning he will NEVER heal even CLOSE to his full hp bar even with spirit visage. If he already has 90% hp, then the most he will heal is around 4.5-5.% hp IF HE MANAGES TO LAND Q on three morons at once.

He will normally land a three man Q like 1-3 times in a game. And then still proceed to blow up instantly afterword.

Skill ceiling should not determine a champs power contribution in a game. The reward of playing a skill champ is the mastery itself and finally unlocking it enough to become viable. Theoretically speaking, in a perfectly balanceable game, all champs have the same contribution potential regardless of simplicity or complexity, but they should of course be able to contribute in different ways. 

Sadly that's not the case, as skill champs are generally superior to others once mastered.

If there is no benefit to playing a more complexe champ, than that champ is a gimmick. You can argue about the degree, but more complexe champs should always have SOME kind of reason to play them over less complexe ones. Period. And that's okay.

Again, my point is that they should have the same potential. Champions should never be arguably better at their highest potential than other champs. While it's virtually impossible to make them 100% equal, the goal should be to make them incredibly close. 

So my point is, skill champs should be such that until you master them, they suck hardcore. Only when mastered should they be viable in ranked. That's not a gimmick. Again, the satisfaction is in the mastery. It's much like anything in life, where expressing skill and mastery is rewarding in and of itself, much like skateboarding or karate, or painting. Most people won't make a living off those things, but many still take pride in being GOOD at them.
